title.name: Onsut organization
title.subtitle: National association for the deaf and hard of earing

about.title: About Us
about.subtitle1:
Onsut Association is a non-profit organization established in 2013, with its main headquarters in Kfar Qara.
The association was founded to serve as a safe reference and resource for people with hearing impairments.
about.subtitle2: Its mission focuses on empowering them, supporting them, and developing their abilities so they can be active and independent members of society.

org.title: About Us
org.paragraph1: Onsut Association for the support of the deaf and hard of hearing is the first association of its kind in the Arab community in the country. It was established in 2013 by Mr. Shadi Eid from the city of Kfar Qara, who has suffered from hearing difficulties since birth. His struggle led him to take the initiative to create a warm home that initially included members of the deaf and hard-of-hearing community from his city, eventually expanding to reach the largest number of deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals from various regions across the country.
org.paragraph2: Today, this warm home has become the largest association in the country within the Arab community supporting deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals. It offers a wide range of services in various fields, which will be detailed in the pages of this humble magazine that we are proud to present to you. This reflects a decade of continuous work, great efforts, and careful, dedicated follow-up to reach the level of excellence we have today at Onsut Association with the deaf and hard-of-hearing community.
org.paragraph3: Onsut Association is distinguished by its inclusiveness, diversity, and uniqueness in everything it offers to the deaf and hard-of-hearing community. The association’s management does not only ensure the rights of its members or oversee their access to these rights; the entire team works to be a genuine partner to every individual in the community across all aspects of their lives. This includes shaping their personality and identity, enhancing their social status, and enabling them to choose the professional path suitable for their life, aiming for independence and to become active, contributing members of society in the place each person aspires to.

founder.title: A Word from the Founder
founder.subtitle: I was not like them; they heard with their ears, while I heard with my heart
founder.paragraph: The call of the heart surpasses and overcomes all difficulties, and this call was the first source of inspiration for what we are today at Onsut Association. I began my journey with this dream, as I previously called it, many years ago, taking the first step toward its realization in 2013. It was the greatest initiative for me, which I worked to bring to life and establish.
founder.name: Shadi Eid

achievments.title: Key Projects and Activities of the Organization
achievments.1: Training dozens of individuals from the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community to teach sign language to the hearing community across the country
achievments.2: Training dozens of individuals from the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community to become instructors for the theoretical driving exam
achievments.3: Winning a tender to open a dedicated community club that serves as a warm home and shared space for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community to experience diverse activities
achievments.4: Awareness lectures to educate Deaf individuals about their rights and responsibilities
achievments.5: Conducting diverse courses and workshops to educate Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals in various fields and areas
achievments.6: Organizing educational courses in multiple fields related to the daily lives of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community
achievments.7: Organizing local and international recreational and cultural trips to expose Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals to the world around them
achievments.8: Hosting an annual event that brings together the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community from different regions and countries, featuring a social, cultural, and recreational program

goals.title: Organization Goals
goals.1: Provide a safe and supportive environment for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community
goals.2: Offer employment opportunities to the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community across various fields
goals.3: Provide educational, vocational, and professional programs for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community
goals.4: Integrate Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals into society and empower them to achieve their potential in all areas
goals.5: Raise awareness about the rights of Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals and how to exercise them
goals.6: Offer all available services to the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community
goals.7: Increase public awareness of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community
goals.8: Empower Deaf and Hard of Hearing individuals with the tools necessary for social and professional development

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: Reach out to us via phone, email, or fax. We're here to help!

support.title: Support Us
support.subtitle: There are many ways to support our mission beyond donations

volunteer.title: Volunteer as a Course Instructor
volunteer.description: If you have knowledge or experience you would like to share, you can volunteer to lead a course or workshop for our members.
points: Teach a short or long-term course
Make a direct impact through education

partnerships.title: Partnerships & Collaborations
partnerships.description: We work with organizations, institutions, and businesses that share our values and want to create positive impact together.

hosting.title: Host a Field Trip
hosting.description: From time to time, we take our members on educational field trips. If you work at a place that can host us, we would love to hear from you.
points: Host a group visit at your workplace

qalansawa.address: Deaf Club Center, behind Social Affairs Building

general.title: Recreational Club for the Deaf
general.subtitle: A safe social space aimed at empowering deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals and fostering communication and belonging.
general.aboutText: The Recreational Club for the Deaf is a social framework designed to bring together deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals in a supportive and stimulating environment, helping them interact and participate in various activities that enhance quality of life.
goals: Strengthen a sense of belonging and community participation
Provide a safe and supportive environment
general.scheduleText: The days and hours of activities vary depending on the club and branch, and schedules are announced through official channels.

list.title: Personal Support for Deaf
list.description: We provide personal support and accompaniment for deaf individuals and people with disabilities in daily situations. This includes accompanying them to public institutions, banks, and government facilities to ensure full access to services and rights.

list.title: Project Development
list.description: We support and encourage people with disabilities to develop their projects and creative ideas. Training and guidance help them leverage their skills to create real work opportunities, fostering financial independence and self-confidence.

list.title: Employment Integration
list.description: We help people with disabilities find suitable jobs and guide them throughout the employment process. This includes skills assessment, coordination with employers, and support to ensure successful integration into the workplace.

list.title: Hearing & Speech Therapy
list.description: We provide diagnostic and therapeutic services for the deaf and hard-of-hearing to improve communication and daily life. Services include regular hearing tests, monitoring speech skills development, and personalized therapy programs.

list.title: Hearing Devices Support
list.description: We offer guidance and support to acquire the right hearing devices for each individual. This includes assessing needs, choosing the appropriate device, and training to use it effectively, while clarifying rights and benefits.

list.title: The Other is Me
list.description: We aim to introduce the hearing community to the world of deaf individuals through awareness programs and educational activities. This project promotes mutual understanding and encourages integration into daily life.

list.title: Future Generation
list.description: We train high school students to become agents of change in their communities. Training includes teaching them how to support deaf individuals, raise awareness, and create an inclusive environment that respects everyone’s rights.

list.title: Learning to Drive
list.description: We support people with disabilities in learning to drive and obtaining a driving license. This includes practical training, guidance on suitable driving schools, and ensuring a safe learning environment.

list.title: Starting a Family
list.description: We provide advisory services and guidance for individuals and families when marrying and starting a family. This includes event coordination, psychological and social support, and enhancing communication between spouses.

list.title: Social Security Support
list.description: We assist with submitting documents and contacting social security to ensure beneficiaries receive their entitlements. This includes file monitoring, legal consultations, and ensuring full application of rights.

list.title: Communication Packages
list.description: We help people with disabilities obtain communication packages and financial support. This includes submitting requests, following up, teaching how to use the benefits, and ensuring effective communication needs are met.

list.title: Roman Kitchen
list.description: We provide professional culinary training alongside social activities and workshops. The project aims to develop practical skills, build self-confidence, and enhance social interaction among beneficiaries.

list.title: Technology Room
list.description: We provide professional training in technology, including camera installation courses, mobile repair, and using modern devices. The focus is on enhancing beneficiaries’ skills and enabling technical independence.

list.title: Academic Support
list.description: We support students academically through guidance, finding suitable institutions, registration assistance, and providing language and enrichment courses to ensure success and full integration into university life.

list.title: Sign Language Course
list.description: The organization provides courses to learn sign language, aiming to empower individuals to communicate with the deaf and raise awareness of sign language.

courseRegisterForm.title: Sign Language Course Registration
courseRegisterForm.agree: I agree to the registration terms and to be contacted
courseRegisterForm.agreeAlert: You must agree to the terms first

items.title: Volunteer Accessories Workshop - Kasra samea Center
items.description: The Ansat Association Center in Kisra-Sumei warmly hosted Basma Special Education School as part of Good Deeds Week. The students conducted a volunteer accessories workshop, creating handmade items alongside members of the association who are deaf and hard of hearing. The activity aimed to strengthen values of giving, inclusion, and meaningful community connection in a warm and collaborative atmosphere.

items.title: Cooking Therapy
items.description: The “Cooking Therapy” course is one of the most popular programs at Ansat Association’s center in Kisra-Sumei and the surrounding area. The course includes several sessions where participants explore cooking from a different perspective, discovering diverse cuisines and their cultural backgrounds in an engaging and enjoyable atmosphere.

items.title: Second Cohort Graduation – CCTV & Security Systems Course
items.description: Ansat Association celebrated the graduation of the second cohort of the “CCTV and Security Systems” course held at the Rayan Vocational Training Center for the deaf and hard of hearing community. The program was led by Mr. Itamar Shalev with interpretation provided by Abeer Ighbariya. The course was selected for its relevance and strong demand in today’s job market, opening new employment opportunities for participants. Congratulations to the graduates and best wishes for continued success.

items.title: Artificial Flower Arrangement Workshop
items.description: Onsut Association organized an artificial flower arrangement workshop where participants learned how to create various designs and combine flowers with different materials to produce unique decorative pieces. The workshop took place in a creative and engaging atmosphere.

items.title: Visit to the Bee Sanctuary and Circassian Heritage Center
items.description:
The association went on a trip to the bee sanctuary "דבורת התבור," where participants learned about the life of bees, what they eat, how honey is produced, and the many health benefits of honey.
Afterwards, they visited the Circassian Heritage Center in Kfar Kama, where they learned about Circassian history and language, and watched a short film about their heritage.
They also took a short tour of the town to see historical buildings, and finally returned to the center to visit the museum and discover more about the local heritage.

items.title: Recreational Trip for Ansat Club Members
items.description: Ansat Association organized a fun and engaging trip for its club members in Kisra-Sumei and Julis, including a visit to Hula Lake with a boat ride in Tiberias, a stop at Nabi Shu'ayb, and concluding with lunch in the area. Participants expressed their enjoyment and happiness.

items.title: Theatrical Trip to Acre
items.description: Mr. Ihab Khaskia invited Ansat Association to his theater in Acre to introduce the deaf and hard of hearing community to the world of acting through performances reflecting the members’ stories. Afterwards, participants visited the city’s main tourist sites, and the trip concluded in a fun and memorable atmosphere, leaving a positive impact on everyone involved.

items.title: Mandala Workshop – Good Deeds Week in Kafr Qara
items.description: As part of Good Deeds Week and in cooperation with the Kafr Qara Local Council, Ansat Association conducted a Mandala workshop for 8th-grade students at Ibn Sina Middle School. The workshop was led by Ms. Rula Abu Raed and accompanied by sign language interpretation provided by Ms. Abeer Ighbariya. The activity promoted creativity, communication, and the values of volunteering and giving. We extend our sincere appreciation and thanks for their meaningful contribution.

items.title: Ramadan Community Initiative – Ansat Children’s Club
items.description: Children of the Ansat Association Club and staff members organized a heartfelt initiative outside the association’s headquarters in Kafr Qara, greeting passersby on the occasion of the holy month. High school students also joined the activity. This initiative reflects the association’s commitment to affirming that the deaf and hard of hearing community is an integral part of society, bringing hope for a stronger and more united community.

items.title: Onsut Association – A Second Home
items.description: Onsut Association serves as a second home for the deaf and hard of hearing community across various regions of the country. Beyond providing services, it creates a true sense of belonging and shared life. Members gather at the association’s center in Kisra-Sumei and nearby areas to spend meaningful time together in a warm and supportive environment.

items.title: Community Gathering in Kisra-Sumei
items.description: Ansat Association continually fosters strong bonds among its members. In a special gesture, member Abeer Kheshan invited members of the Kisra-Sumei center and surrounding area to her home for a shared dinner. The gathering was well attended and filled with warmth, joy, and a true sense of family.

items.title: Cancer Awareness Day
items.description: Ansat Association organized a cancer awareness day at the Deaf and Hard of Hearing Club, including a lecture on the importance of early detection, clinical examinations, and medical consultations for participants. The day focused on raising health awareness and promoting early screening as a key step in dealing with the disease.

items.title: Ramadan Iftar Evening – Onsut Association, Qalansawe
items.description: The Onsut Association in the city of Qalansawe held a special Ramadan Iftar evening for the eighth consecutive year. The event was dedicated to the association’s members in the city, bringing together dozens of participants around a shared Iftar meal in a warm atmosphere filled with unity, appreciation, and community spirit. During the evening, the association’s director, Mr. Shadi Eid, congratulated the members on the holy month and the approaching Eid al-Fitr, wishing everyone blessed days filled with goodness and happiness.

items.title: Annual Ramadan Charity Evening – 8th Year
items.description: Ansat Association held its annual Ramadan charity evening for the eighth consecutive year, bringing together members of the deaf and hard of hearing community from across the country for a festive Iftar in Kafr Qara. The evening featured welcoming remarks, a silent performance, and children’s entertainment, made possible through the support of generous partners and contributors.
